reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On traveling through we decided to stop in Adair. Came across Carrabawn guesthouse and were very pleased with the room and the welcome. Parking enclosed at front of house. Walking distance to bars and shops in Adair. After good nights sleep we had a lovely cooked breakfast. It was well cooked and presented. Would stay again if in area. Paid on leaving and paid cash as card machine not working. This was not a problem as we were warned of this on our arrival.
reviews.title: Best breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on the way to Kerry but having heard of the village of Adare decided to stay a couple of nights, we were fortunate to have found the Carrabawn by chance, albeit exhausted on the first night we slept like logs and were provided with a wonderful breakfast the next morning which lasted us most of the day.
reviews.title: Londoners enroute

reviews.text: As there was much to see and do in the area we stayed a second night and therefore the location was perfect.
reviews.title: Carrabawn B&B

reviews.text: Many thanks Niamh for a wonderful couple of days and apologies for not commenting before returning to London.
reviews.title: Thanks Niamh for your wonderful hospitality! (bit late but better late than never!)
Great Value Guest House in Adare
